title: Ozil lashes Henry and reveals Arsenal ultimatum
text:
Arsenal transfer news, Mesut Ozil contract, Wayne Rooney scoring record: Paper Talk Staff writers, FOX SPORTS January 9, 2017 12:44pm 
MESUT Ozil reveals what is required for him to stay at Arsenal, confusion over Wayne Rooney’s scoring record and Steven Gerrard with a moment to make your heart melt. 
It’s a Paper Talk to kick your week off... 
MESUT OZIL LASHES HENRY 
The future of Mesut Ozil at Arsenal comes down to Arsene Wenger. 
That’s what the German star has revealed in response to criticism from club legend Thierry Henry, who claimed he and Alexis Sanchez are “holding the club hostage” with their wage demands. 
With 18 months to run on his contract, speculation has been rife that Ozil could be heading for the exit door unless the club matches his lofty wage demands of £200,000 per week. 
That prompted Henry to claim such money should result in “a hat-trick every week – and also when there’s no game”. 
But Ozil has explained that before resigning, he first wants assurances about the future of Wenger, who brought the former Real Madrid man to the club. media_camera Arsenal manager Arsene Wenger shakes hands with Mesut Ozil. 
“Everybody has the right to say his opinion but these statements do not interest me,” Ozil told German magazine Kicker. 
“Such ex-players or other people...do not know what is actually spoken between the club and me.” 
He added: “I am very, very happy at Arsenal and have let the club know that I would be ready to sign a new contract. 
“The fans want that I stay and now it is just down to the club. 
“They know that I am here most of all because of Arsene Wenger. He is the one who signed me and he is the one whose trust I have. The club also knows that I want to be clear what the manager is going to do.” 
ROONEY’S RECORD DEBATED 
The congratulations were flowing when Wayne Rooney scored early in Manchester United’s win over Reading – netting his 249th goal for the club. 
‘He’s done it!’ we all thought, with the skipper seemingly levelling Sir Bobby Charlton’s all-time scoring record for the Red Devils. 
But then there was a twist, with questions emerging whether Charlton scored 249 or 251 goals for the club. 
The point of confusion came over two goals Charlton scored against Hellas Verona in the Anglo-Italian Cup in 1973. 
While the club considers the 79-year-old’s final appearance to come against Chelsea a few days earlier, the official site also makes reference to the game . 
‘Sir Bobby subsequently played in the Anglo-Italian Cup, away to Verona on 2 May, and scored twice in United’s 4-1 win. However, this game is not counted as one of his 758 competitive appearances,’ United’s official site explains. 
‘WELCOME TO THE REAL WORLD, LIVERPOOL’ 
Liverpool are set for a reality check when they face Plymouth in the FA Cup 3rd Round replay. 
They plucky League Two side travelled to Anfield to face Liverpool’s youngest ever starting XI and came away with a 0-0 result. 
And manager Derek Adams has made one thing clear – you’re about to find out what life is like in the real world! Liverpool held scoreless 0:39 
FA Cup: Liverpool have been held scoreless by second tier side Plymouth. January 9th 2017 /video/video.news.com.au/Sport/Football/News/ Liverpool held scoreless 
“The fans have a long trip home, but they were very vocal for us and deserved the day out – everybody at the club is very happy,” he said. 
“We look forward to taking them back. Look forward to what they will experience there: welcome to the real world! Our dressing rooms are not as luxurious as they have here... and they’ve got portacabins here at the moment.” 
JOSE MOURINHO’S HALF TIME TALK REVEALED 
Manchester United beat Reading 4-0 in the FA Cup over the weekend, with youngster Marcus Rashford netting twice. 
But coming into the half time break, manager Jose Mourinho had a simple message to keep the 19-year-old’s feet on the ground. 
“The goals for an attacking player are always nice,” Mourinho told MUTV after the game.” 
“For his confidence it is important he scores these goals but we won against West Ham with his contribution, we won against Middlesbrough with his contribution, and he didn’t score goals. Report: United cruise to win 1:31 
FA Cup: Manchester United have begun their title defence in emphatic fashion, making short work of second tier side Reading. January 8th 2017 /video/video.news.com.au/Sport/Football/News/ Report: United cruise to win 
“I spoke to him at half-time and I told him that I don’t care about the goals he missed in the first half. He had a big responsibility in the way we were breaking down their defensive line, he was playing so well for us so one less goal doesn’t change it for an attacking player. 
“He’s quick and against these teams we know they play from the back and use the goalkeeper very much. You press and you can get things.” 
STEVEN GERRARD PAYS A VISIT TO FAN 
Every now and then, there’s a story that warms your heart – and this from Steven Gerrard is one of them. 
Video has emerged of the Liverpool legend visiting the house of young brain cancer sufferer Charlie. 
Rocking up unannounced, Stevie G knocked on the door and the reaction of Charlie is priceless. WAYNE BROWN SHARES BABY NEWS 
Newcastle Jets’ Wayne Brown was forced to hail a taxi at half time of his side’s win over Brisbane Roar after hearing his wife had gone into labour a week early. 
Racing to the airport to return from the away trip in time, Brown made it to the hospital in time to be there for the birth of their second child, a baby boy, Oscar. 👶🏼 BABY BROWN HAS ARRIVED! Congratulations to @Waynebrown2121 & his family on the safe arrival of Oscar Brown, born 11:59pm on 08.01.2017! 🍼 — NEWCASTLE JETS FC ✈️ (@NewcastleJetsFC) January 8, 2017 
Tottenham star Harry Kane also had some baby news – with his partner Kate Goodland giving birth to a baby girl. Me and @KateGoodlandx had our beautiful baby girl this morning, Ivy Jane Kane at 7:30am. Weighing 7.8pounds. Amazing feeling, so proud!😍❤👶🏼 — Harry Kane (@HKane) January 8, 2017 
Mauricio Pochettino kindly gave his star striker the day off, as Tottenham beat Aston Villa in the FA Cup overnight. 
JULIAN DRAXLER PERFORMS INITIATION SONG 
Julian Draxler started off life at Paris Saint-Germain by scoring a goal on debut in their 7-0 rout of Bastia. 
And then he completed the age-old tradition of singing in front of his teammates in this awkward initiation. A video posted by Blaise Matuidi Officiel (@blaisematuidiofficiel) on Jan 7, 2017 at 4:53am PST 
ONE FOR DOG LOVERS 
Lionel Messi has shared another photo of his dog before scoring a crucial and classy free kick to seal a point for Barcelona against Villarreal. 
The Argentine superstar’s mastiff is just over a year old ... but look at the size of him! A photo posted by AntoRoccuzzo88 (@antoroccuzzo88) on Jan 7, 2017 at 1:50pm PST
